content: I just enlisted, leaving for basic March 24th. I would like to know how I would go about cross training from 11-bang bang to 68W when the time comes. 68W was not shipping out to basic until April 28; I was not waiting that long and there was no guarantee I would be able to go to Ft. Benning for basic. Therefore, I went with 11Bang Bang to lock it down. Please advise on how to go about this! Thank you in advanced! P.S. - Any advise on how to get into AA School /Airborne as well Question: I would like to know how I would go about cross training from 11-bang bang to 68W when the time comes. Choices: Help Please Help
reply: I just enlisted, leaving for basic March 24th. I would like to know how I would go about cross training from 11-bang bang to 68W when the time comes. 68W was not shipping out to basic until April 28; I was not waiting that long and there was no guarantee I would be able to go to Ft. P.S. - Any advise on how to get into AA School /Airborne as well Question: I would like to know how I would go about cross training from 11-bang bang to 68W when the time comes. Benning. just thanked me for my help and called me a shmuck.. no big deal... and he's never going to make it to Benning...... many talk their schit about being a "trooper" and as the time draws near to actually go to the training they opt out.... seen it many times. Hell, even I thought about it after AIT.. but for me it was a "put-up" or shut-up situation... I was talking the talk back on the block.. no way could I go home without those wings.. that first step out the door however was a nightime jump (eyes tightly closed) but after the canope opened, I was in love... better then sex. Course then, sex was something only read in books. and had no other point of reference. One Flag......One Heart......One Nation............EVERMORE

content: Air Assalt or AA school, and 68W is Combat Medic or a.k.a Health Care Specialist

title: 11Bang Bang -68W Cross Trainig

content: quote: Originally posted by 20469861: Air Assalt or AA school, and 68W is Combat Medic or a.k.a Health Care Specialist to be an infantryman plus a combat medic might be difficult and you might have to finish your original enlistment obligation to make the switch. As for air assault I don't see a problem.. I'm thinking the 101st.. they're AA now. Airborne? Yes you can be all of the above plus Airborne.. but like I said in my first post it is an entirely different animal from atlking about it and actually doing it. Many, many don't follow through when it comes down to the wire.. that said. I appreciate your reassessment of your original comments and thank you for wanting to serve - it is a great honor to do so. One Flag......One Heart......One Nation............EVERMORE
quote: Originally posted by 20469861: Air Assalt or AA school, and 68W is Combat Medic or a.k.a Health Care Specialist

I'm thinking the 101st.. they're AA now. Airborne? Yes you can be all of the above plus Airborne.. but like I said in my first post it is an entirely different animal from atlking about it and actually doing it. content: quote: Originally posted by 20469861: i corrected the post .....now would you like to help me ?? Correct me if I'm wrong, but 68W is a combat medic, right? If that's so, you're screwed, blued and tatooed. You've volunteered for 11B (Infantry) training and that's the training you'll get. You'll have to successfully complete OSUT at Ft. Benning and go to your first unit before you can even attempt to change your MOS. And, don't even think about failing to complete Infantry OSUT on purpose. All you'll get from that is sent home with a bar to re-enlistment.
quote: Originally posted by 20469861: i corrected the post .....now would you like to help me ??
reply: Correct me if I'm wrong, but 68W is a combat medic, right? If that's so, you're screwed, blued and tatooed. You've volunteered for 11B (Infantry) training and that's the training you'll get. You'll have to successfully complete OSUT at Ft. Benning and go to your first unit before you can even attempt to change your MOS. And, don't even think about failing to complete Infantry OSUT on purpose. All you'll get from that is sent home with a bar to re-enlistment.
title: 11Bang Bang -68W Cross Trainig

You'll have to successfully complete OSUT at Ft. Benning and go to your first unit before you can even attempt to change your MOS. And, don't even think about failing to complete Infantry OSUT on purpose. All you'll get from that is sent home with a bar to re-enlistment.
title: 11Bang Bang -68W Cross Trainig

content: I just enlisted, leaving for basic March 24th. I would like to know how I would go about cross training from 11-bang bang to 68W when the time comes. 68W was not shipping out to basic until April 28; I was not waiting that long and there was no guarantee I would be able to go to Ft. Benning for basic. Therefore, I went with 11Bang Bang to lock it down. Please advise on how to go about this! Thank you in advanced! P.S. - Any advise on how to get into AA School /Airborne as well Question: I would like to know how I would go about cross training from 11-bang bang to 68W when the time comes. Benning. just thanked me for my help and called me a shmuck.. no big deal... and he's never going to make it to Benning...... many talk their schit about being a "trooper" and as the time draws near to actually go to the training they opt out.... seen it many times. Hell, even I thought about it after AIT.. but for me it was a "put-up" or shut-up situation... I was talking the talk back on the block.. no way could I go home without those wings.. that first step out the door however was a nightime jump (eyes tightly closed) but after the canope opened, I was in love... better then sex. Course then, sex was something only read in books. and had no other point of reference. One Flag......One Heart......One Nation............EVERMORE

content: Air Assalt or AA school, and 68W is Combat Medic or a.k.a Health Care Specialist
reply: Air Assalt or AA school, and 68W is Combat Medic or a.k.a Health Care Specialist
title: 11Bang Bang -68W Cross Trainig

content: quote: Originally posted by 20469861: Air Assalt or AA school, and 68W is Combat Medic or a.k.a Health Care Specialist to be an infantryman plus a combat medic might be difficult and you might have to finish your original enlistment obligation to make the switch. As for air assault I don't see a problem.. I'm thinking the 101st.. they're AA now. Airborne? Yes you can be all of the above plus Airborne.. but like I said in my first post it is an entirely different animal from atlking about it and actually doing it. Many, many don't follow through when it comes down to the wire.. that said. I appreciate your reassessment of your original comments and thank you for wanting to serve - it is a great honor to do so. One Flag......One Heart......One Nation............EVERMORE
